title: Professional Development Program for Secondary Physics Pedagogy Using Augmented Reality-Based Mobile Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental physics concepts and general instructional methods
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service teachers exploring methods to integrate augmented reality technology into physics instruction.

learning_goals: Cultivation of project design skills to visually explain physics concepts (energy, motion, waves, etc.) using augmented reality content.
Development of competencies in designing and implementing student-centered physics lessons using mobile learning tools.
Fostering the ability to develop augmented reality learning modules by applying the ADDIE model-based instructional design process.
Strengthening the capacity to analyze learner achievement and provide feedback through project-based assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
